dry.translation[0].definitions[0].defini: without water or liquid inside or on the surface
dry.translation[0].definitions[0].exampl: I need to change into some dry clothes.
Make sure that the surface is clean and dry before you start to paint.
You should store disks in a cool, dry place.
The path is dry as a bone (=very dry).
dry.translation[0].definitions[1].defini: having very little rain or moisture
dry.translation[0].definitions[1].exampl: The weather was hot and dry.
Eastern areas should stay dry tomorrow.
These plants do not grow well in dry conditions (=when there is not much rain).
dry.translation[0].definitions[2].defini: someone with a dry sense of humour says funny and clever things while seeming to be serious
dry.translation[0].definitions[2].exampl: He had a delightfully dry sense of humour.
dry.translation[0].definitions[3].defini: boring, very serious, and without humour
dry.translation[0].definitions[3].exampl: In schools, science is often presented in a dry and uninteresting manner.
dry.translation[0].definitions[4].defini: not drinking alcohol, or not allowing any alcohol to be sold
dry.translation[0].definitions[4].exampl: Paula had been dry for a year before she started drinking again.
dry.translation[0].definitions[5].defini: showing no emotion when you speak
dry.translation[0].definitions[5].exampl: ‘Good evening gentlemen, ’ he said, in a dry voice.
dry.translation[0].note_box[0].sections[: There had been no rain and the grass was very dry.
I had no dry clothes to change into.
It was good to get off the ship onto dry land again.
Add the eggs and milk to the dry ingredients.
We managed to keep dry inside an old farm building.
He wiped his hands dry with a handkerchief.
Towel your hair dry before using a hairdryer.
These plants need some water – they’re dry as a bone.
dry.translation[0].note_box[1].sections[: having very little moisture, or no longer wet
How do plants survive in hot dry conditions?
The ground was bone dry (=completely dry).
completely dry – used about land, or about someone’s lips, throat, skin etc
The earth was so parched that there were huge cracks in it.
extremely dry because of lack or rain and therefore difficult for growing crops
the arid landscape of the Danakil desert
dry.translation[1].definitions[0].defini: to make something dry, or to become dry
dry.translation[1].definitions[0].exampl: Mrs Brown hung the washing on the line to dry.
He was drying his hair with a towel.
Leave the first coat of paint to dry before adding another.
She stood up and dried her eyes (=wiped away her tears).
He quickly dried himself on the thin towel.
dry.translation[1].definitions[1].defini: to rub plates, dishes etc dry with a cloth after they have been washed
dry.translation[1].definitions[1].exampl: Shall I dry up these glasses?
Dry belongs to a group of verbs where the same noun can be the subject of the verb or its object
In this sentence, ‘the washing’ is the object of dry
I’m drying the washing on the line
In this sentence, ‘the washing’ is the subject of dry
The washing is drying on the line
